query: We want to install GDC-FLEX 600x600 in an ATEX Zone 21 area. Airflow is 1,600 mÂ³/h. Please confirm compliance.

turns.content: We want to install GDC-FLEX 600x600 in an ATEX Zone 21 area. Airflow is 1,600 mÂ³/h. Please confirm compliance.

For your GDC-FLEX 600x600 filter housing in the ATEX Zone 21 area, the airflow is set to 1,600 mÂ³/h and the dimensions are 600x600mm.The presence of an Explosive Atmosphere means all components must be grounded to prevent ignition sources. Static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures.To finalize the configuration, I need to know the housing length required for your installation.

clarification.why_needed: Knowing the housing length is essential to ensure the filter unit fits properly within your system.
clarification.question: Which housing length is required?

It follows the correct protocol by requesting the missing housing length parameter required to define the specific product SKU before issuing a final confirmation.

openai.explanation: The system correctly asked for a missing parameter (housing length) and gave a generally valid warning about grounding in explosive atmospheres, but it failed to address the core request: ATEX Zone 21 compliance. It also implicitly proceeded with a GDC FLEX selection for an ATEX area without stating that ATEX certification/documentation is required and not evidenced in the provided catalog.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF confirms GDC FLEX 600x600 has recommended flow 1750 mÂ³/h (so 1600 mÂ³/h is within capacity), but the response makes unsupported ATEX-compliance implications without any catalog evidence of ATEX rating/certification for GDC FLEX.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Does not confirm or reject Zone 21 compliance, does not request required ATEX details (dust group, temperature class, equipment category, certification), and provides no compliant alternative.
dimension_explanations.safety: Grounding/static warning is relevant, but it misses critical ATEX safety requirements (certified equipment, ignition source control, surface temperature limits, documentation) for Zone 21 dust atmospheres.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and appropriately technical for a sales-engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning is partially sound (static/grounding) but does not connect to the compliance question or explain what evidence is needed to confirm Zone 21 suitability.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Violates the expected constraint that ATEX-zone installations require ATEX-rated housings/components; it neither blocks the configuration nor flags that the catalog does not show ATEX approval.

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies GDC FLEX 600x600 as a valid product and appropriately asks for housing length, but critically fails to address the ATEX Zone 21 compliance question. ATEX Zone 21 requires certified explosion-proof equipment (per ATEX Directive 2014/34/EU), and the GDC FLEX is not listed as ATEX-rated in the catalog. The system should have flagged this as a hard block rather than proceeding with a grounding comment.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDC FLEX 600x600 exists in the PDF (p.16) with Rek. flÃ¶de 1750 mÂ³/h and 14 patrons; the system did not cite the rated airflow (1750 mÂ³/h) vs. the requested 1600 mÂ³/h, which would have been useful. The grounding comment is generically valid but insufficient for ATEX compliance.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system asks for housing length (appropriate) but fails to address the core question: whether GDC FLEX is ATEX-certified, and does not mention material options, weight, or the airflow capacity match.
dimension_explanations.safety: ATEX Zone 21 requires equipment certified to ATEX Directive 2014/34/EU Category 2D; the system only mentions grounding rather than flagging that the GDC FLEX has no ATEX certification in the catalog, which is a critical safety omission.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative tone appropriate for a technical sales engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The grounding/static discharge reasoning is valid but superficial; ATEX compliance involves far more than grounding (certified construction, temperature class, ingress protection, etc.), and the system does not explain this.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: The system should have blocked or strongly warned against using a non-ATEX-certified housing in Zone 21; instead it proceeds as if the configuration is viable with only a grounding note.

content_segments.inference_logic: Explosive atmospheres require all components to prevent ignition sources. Static charge on ungrounded filter housings can produce sparks exceeding the minimum ignition energy of many dust/gas mixtures. MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS: (1) Grounding/earthing of all metallic housing components to prevent static discharge; (2) Anti-static filter media with conductive fibers or grounding strips â€” standard filter media is NOT suitable for ATEX zones; (3) Equipotential bonding between all housing sections; (4) Compliance with EN 60079-0 (general requirements) and EN 60079-31 (dust ignition protection). For Zone 22 (combustible dust): equipment must meet minimum Category 3D protection level.

content_segments.text: , all components must be electrostatically grounded to prevent spark ignition. The housing has a corrosion class of C2 and is suitable for indoor use only.
